item.title: 情報筋Audacyは、広告収入の減少に苦しむ中、19億ドルの債務再編に向けて金融債権者との交渉を開始する模様（Alexander Gladstone/Wall Street Journal）。
item.description:
Alexander Gladstone / Wall Street Journal:
Sources: Audacy is set to begin negotiations with financial creditors to restructure its $1.9B in debt as it struggles with declining advertising revenue  —  Audacy has said that it might not satisfy debt obligations as it faces a weak radio advertising market

item.title: ハリウッドのトップが、SAG-AFTRAのストライキを回避するために連邦調停者を呼ぶことを計画している。
item.description:
Variety:
Top Hollywood executives plan to call in federal mediators to help avert a SAG-AFTRA strike, which could start as soon as July 13, after the contract expires  —  A group of CEOs and senior executives, including Disney chief Bob Iger, Warner Bros. Discovery's David Zaslav and Netflix's Ted Sarandos …

item.title: 情報筋DisneyはStar India事業の戦略的選択肢を模索中、Media Partners AsiaはDisney+ Hotstarは2023年度に1500万加入者を失うと試算（Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
Sources: Disney is exploring strategic options for its Star India business; Media Partners Asia estimates Disney+ Hotstar could lose 15M subscribers in FY 2023  —  Talks are a sign of how Star India's fortunes have changed since Disney's purchase of Fox entertainment assets

item.title: テキサスA&M大学、ジャーナリズム・プログラム復活のためテキサス大学教授へのオファーを弱める。
item.description:
Kate McGee / The Texas Tribune:
Texas A&M weakened its offer to a University of Texas professor to revive its journalism program, after backlash about DEI and her NYT past; she's staying at UT  —  The university celebrated its decision to hire Kathleen McElroy to revive its journalism program.

item.title: Twitterのコミュニティ・ノートのボランティア投稿者は、サイト上で横行するスパムや偽情報のチェックについて詳述し、このツールは十分とは言い難いと述べている（Nitish Pahwa/Slate）
item.description:
Nitish Pahwa / Slate:
A volunteer contributor for Twitter's Community Notes details checking rampant spam and disinformation across the site and says the tool is far from sufficient  —  Twitter's “Community Notes” volunteers are supposed to make the platform “the most accurate source of information about the world.”

item.title: シリア、BBCの地元記者2人のメディア認定を取り消し、情報省が「虚偽」「政治的」と報道（ロイター）
item.description:
Reuters:
Syria cancels the media accreditation of two local journalists working for the BBC over what the information ministry calls “false” and “politicized” coverage  —  Syria's information ministry said on Saturday it had cancelled the accreditation of two local journalists working …

item.title: レイオフの1日後、破産申請の2週間前の4月28日に、バイス幹部たちの70万ドル以上の給与とボーナスの総額が100万ドル以上であったことを示す書類（Charlie Nash/Mediaite）
item.description:
Charlie Nash / Mediaite:
Filings show Vice executives' $700K+ salaries and collective bonuses totaling $1M+ on April 28, one day after layoffs and two weeks before the bankruptcy filing  —  Vice senior staff writer Joseph Cox shared the eye-popping payments made to Vice Media executives who “led VICE to bankruptcy” on Monday.

item.title: ワシントン・ポスト紙がベライゾンの+play購読アグリゲーション・ハブに参加する最初の主要全国紙となる。
item.description:
Washington Post:
The Washington Post becomes the first major national newspaper to join Verizon's +play subscription aggregation hub; new Post subscribers get three months free  —  The Washington Post announced today that it has joined Verizon's +play - giving Verizon customers an exclusive three-month subscription …

item.title: スキャンダルの渦中にあるBBCの司会者が、ネット上で彼を名指しして接触したことをほのめかした後、脅迫メールを送ってきたという若者（BBC）
item.description:
BBC:
A young person says the BBC presenter at the center of a scandal sent them threatening texts after they alluded online to naming and having contact with him  —  A young person has told BBC News they felt threatened by the BBC presenter at the centre of a row over payment for sexually explicit photos.

item.title: シャッターストック、OpenAIとの6年間にわたるパートナーシップの拡大を発表、AIトレーニングのために同社のビデオ、画像、音楽ライブラリへのアクセスを許可、SSTKは9%以上急上昇（Ashley Capoot/CNBC）
item.description:
Ashley Capoot / CNBC:
Shutterstock announces an expanded, six-year partnership with OpenAI that grants access to its video, image, and music libraries for AI training; SSTK jumps 9%+  —  - Shares of Shutterstock popped Tuesday after the company announced an expanded, six-year partnership with ChatGPT-maker OpenAI.

item.title: CNNは7月10日午後9時（米国東部時間）から、ケイトラン・コリンズがキャスターを務めるゴールデンタイムの新番組「ザ・ソース」をスタートさせた。
item.description:
Adam Buckman / MediaPost:
CNN launched a new weeknight primetime show, “The Source”, anchored by Kaitlan Collins, on July 10 at 9pm ET; Collins most recently co-anchored CNN This Morning  —  It's musical chairs in cable news as two of the three cable news channels remake their prime-time lineups.

item.title: BBCによると、2022-2023年のタレント給与総額は1,000万ポンド増の1億3,980万ポンドとなり、2020年以降で最高となった。
item.description:
Jake Kanter / Deadline:
The BBC says total talent pay rose by £10M to £139.8M in 2022-2023, the highest since 2020; salaries for presenters earning £150K+ totaled £23.4M, up 15% YoY  —  The BBC has revealed that the amount paid to its biggest stars has surged to a six-year high …

item.title: ティム・デイヴィによると、警察はBBCに対し、犯罪捜査が正当化されるかどうかを判断するため、停職中の男性司会者についての捜査を一時停止するよう要請した（Jim Waterson/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Jim Waterson / The Guardian:
Tim Davie says police asked the BBC to pause its investigation into a suspended male presenter as officers decide if a criminal investigation would be justified  —  Corporation's director general reveals request as officers consider if there is reason for a criminal inquiry

item.title: BBC、2022-2023年のBBCスタジオの売上高は前年比28％増の20.9億ポンド、EBITDAは前年比6％増の2.4億ポンド、BBCへの利益還元は過去最高の3.62億ポンドを記録（Georg Szalai/Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Georg Szalai / Hollywood Reporter:
The BBC reports record BBC Studios revenue up 28% YoY to £2.09B in 2022-2023, EBITDA rose 6% YoY to £240M, and returns to the BBC reached a record £362M  —  Thanks to hit content, such as ‘Happy Valley,’ 'Bluey, and ‘Dancing With the Stars,’ the commercial arm …

item.title: BBCは2022-2023年に1億2,000万ポンドの赤字と57億ポンドの過去最高収入を計上、前年同期の53億3,000万ポンドから増加、ライセンス料は37億4,000万ポンドで前年同期の38億ポンドから減少（Naman Ramachandran/Variety）
item.description:
Naman Ramachandran / Variety:
The BBC reports a £120M deficit and a £5.7B record income in 2022-2023, up from £5.33B a year ago; license fee payments were £3.74B, down from £3.8B a year ago  —  The BBC has posted a record income of £5.7 billion ($7.2 billion) for the 2022/23 period …
